summary: This document is a series of email exchanges from September 2020 between U.S. federal prosecutors (SDNY) and a legal attaché (LEGAT) in London regarding a witness in the Jeffrey Epstein investigation. The discussion centers on whether to share the witness's identity with the UK's Metropolitan Police, the legal requirements for doing so, and the logistics of coordinating an interview. The witness is in England and reported past abuse by Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Identified as the perpetrator of past abuse against a witness who is the subject of the email discussion.

persons.name: cza
persons.context: Sent an email requesting a call to close the loop on conversations with the LEGAT.

connections.description: The witness reported past abuse by Jeffrey Epstein, as discussed in the emails.
M's colleagues connected with the witness's attorney, who consented to sharing the witness's name with the Met Police.

events.title: Coordination on Witness Disclosure to UK Police
events.description: Email chain discusses obtaining consent from a witness's attorney to share her name with the Metropolitan Police and determining the proper legal channels for notification.

events.title: Phone Call Regarding SDNY Investigation
events.description: Reference to a prior phone call between SDNY prosecutors and the LEGAT (M) about the witness and investigation coordination.

keyFacts: A witness in England reported past abuse by Jeffrey Epstein to U.S. authorities (SDNY).
The witness's attorney consented to sharing the witness's identity with the UK's Metropolitan Police.
U.S. prosecutors were coordinating with a Legal Attaché (LEGAT) in London on the legal procedures for international witness cooperation.
The emails show active investigation and international coordination in the Epstein case as of September 2020.
Key details about the abuse (location, perpetrator specifics, victim's age at the time) had not been confirmed by U.S. investigators at the time of the emails.
